snippet: Soccer officials consider hijabs — headscarves that cover the hair, neck and ears — a safety concern, and prohibit players from wearing them during games.
abstract: International soccer rules board is poised to consider the long-disputed ban on hijabs, headscarves worn by Muslim women that cover the hair, neck and ears; a symbol of piety for Muslims, hijabs have been prohibited during games because officials say it is a safety concern, an issue that has driven female Muslim players away from the sport.
lead_paragraph: Soccer officials consider hijabs — headscarves that cover the hair, neck and ears — a safety concern, and prohibit players from wearing them during games.

headline.seo: Soccer Rules Board to Consider Ending Ban On Hijabs
headline.main: Rules Board to Consider Ending Ban on Hijabs
